column4: I'm running Xubuntu on a Dell Latitude c610. I was wondering if anyone knows how to set up an external monitor (i.e. clone, extended desktop, etc.)? The video card is an ATI radeon mobility
The_giver, have you tried the alternate text installer?
Does anyone know why the text installer isn't included somewhere in the regular iso? It seems like it would be easy to do.
it would not
the live contains the OS, the alternate contains the packages
the live CD has to include the packages too, right? I mean, it does INSTALL those packages, right?
actually not
i'm not sure, but i think that it brutally copies the live cd to the hd
which VGA?
yes, it's a VGA output. The card is a ATI Radeon Mobility. Right now I'm running the FOSS "ati" driver, but I'd be willing to switch to proprietary drivers if necessary.
depends
if it's <= 9250 the FOSS drivers rock
if what is, the card? It's an older card, I think the FOSS drivers are pretty solid.
lspci | grep -i vga, check
ATI Technologies Inc Radeon Mobility M6 LY
meh
indeed.
that's all it says?
Google seems to indicate it's an "M6" chipset
google for dual head howto
basically you have to duplicate your monitor and screen sections
ok thanks. Will that get me an extended desktop? Clone mode seems to be working automagically.
clone mode is the default behavior
i would paste my Xorg config, but i'm using fglrx
